en.purpose: To automate the calculation of the prostate cancer risk group to support clinical decision-making based on the swedish national guidelines.
en.use: Use in patients with prostate cancer confirmed to be without distant metastases (M0 stage).
en.misuse: Not to be used for patients with known metastatic disease (M1), recurrent prostate cancer after primary treatment, or for assessing the risk of other types of cancer. Do not use if any of the mandatory input parameters (T-stage, Gleason, PSA) are unknown.

other_details.references:
Zumsteg ZS, Spratt DE, Pei I, Zhang Z, Yamada Y, Kollmeier M, Zelefsky MJ. A new risk classification system for therapeutic decision making with intermediate-risk prostate cancer patients undergoing dose-escalated external-beam radiation therapy. Eur Urol. 2013 Dec;64(6):895-902. doi: 10.1016/j.eururo.2013.03.033. Epub 2013 Mar 23. PMID: 23541457.

Gnanapragasam VJ, Bratt O, Muir K, Lee LS, Huang HH, Stattin P, Lophatananon A. The Cambridge Prognostic Groups for improved prediction of disease mortality at diagnosis in primary non-metastatic prostate cancer: a validation study. BMC Med. 2018 Feb 28;16(1):31. doi: 10.1186/s12916-018-1019-5. PMID: 29490658; PMCID: PMC5831573.
other_details.en: Applies the Swedish National Guidelines to classify localized prostate cancer into Very low, Low, Favorable Intermediate, Unfavorable Intermediate, High, or Very High risk groups based on recorded clinical parameters.

when: $gt0023|Histological findings ≤ 8 mm cancer in total in 1–4 of 8–12 systematic biopsy cores|==local::at0021|Yes|
$gt0023|Histological findings ≤ 8 mm cancer in total in 1–4 of 8–12 systematic biopsy cores|==local::at0022|No|

($gt0019|T-stage|==local::at0005|T2b/T2c|&&$gt0020|Gleason score|==local::at0010|7 (3+4) (ISUP 2)|)||($gt0019|T-stage|==local::at0005|T2b/T2c|&&$gt0021|PSA|==local::at0017|10–19 µg/l|)||($gt0020|Gleason score|==local::at0010|7 (3+4) (ISUP 2)|&&$gt0021|PSA|==local::at0017|10–19 µg/l|)||local::at0012|7 (4+3) (ISUP 3)|||local::at0011|7 (3+4) (ISUP 2)  in more than half of systematic biopsy specimens|

gt0001.description: Applies the Swedish National Guidelines to classify localized prostate cancer into risk groups based on recorded clinical parameters.

gt0023.text: Histological findings ≤ 8 mm cancer in total in 1–4 of 8–12 systematic biopsy cores

gt0024.text: Strong suspicion of extraprostatic growth on MRI (EPE/SVI 5)
